meanings.definition: Showing great attention to detail or precision
meanings.sent1: She was the nittiest student in the class, always double-checking her work for any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The artist's nittiest brush strokes brought out the intricate details in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The nittiest detective in town never missed a clue, even the tiniest ones.
meanings.sent4: Her nittiest sewing skills ensured that every stitch was perfectly in place.
meanings.sent5: The nittiest chef in the kitchen could taste the slightest difference in seasoning.

meanings.definition: Covered in or resembling small knots or tangles
meanings.sent1: The nittiest yarn was difficult to untangle, but it made the coziest scarves.
meanings.sent2: Her hair was nittiest after a windy day at the beach, full of tiny knots.
meanings.sent3: The nittiest branches of the old tree intertwined like a natural puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The nittiest fabric caught on thorns easily, creating a tangled mess.
meanings.sent5: The nittiest rope was perfect for climbing, providing a secure grip.

meanings.definition: The superlative form of the adjective 'nitty'
meanings.sent1: She won the award for being the nittiest of all the nitty students in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: The nittiest of the kittens had the softest fur and the most playful nature.
meanings.sent3: Being the nittiest of the group, he always paid attention to the smallest details.
meanings.sent4: The nittiest of the puzzle pieces was the hardest to fit into place.
meanings.sent5: In the world of tiny creatures, the ant was considered the nittiest of them all.
